p: Misperceptions about influenza severity. Understandings about the severity of influenza varied widely. 29 participants (38.2% of the sample) perceived influenza to be serious and fatal providing insights including, “ If [influenza is] not taken care of, you [might] get pneumonia. And you hear people dying of pneumonia, which is ridiculous. I mean, our former P[rime] M[inister] Mr. Lee Kuan Yew died of pneumonia too” (Male, interview 41). On the other end of the spectrum, 26 participants (34.2% of the sample) regarded influenza as a minor illness of little concern: “ The flu is not so serious. Heart attack, very serious… diabetes, very serious… cancer, very serious, more important” (Female, interview 28).
